title: The Quakers Ballad: or, An hymn of triumph and exultation for their victories at the two late great disputes by them held with the baptists; the first in Barbicon, on the 9th. the second in VVheeler-street, on the 16th. of the eight month, 1674. To an excellent new tune, called, The zealous atheist.
notes: Verse - "Ye she-friends and he-friends whoe her inherit".
In two parts; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
